outputs.output_descr: Preparation of ODS (Ozone Depleting Substances) bank management and destruction demonstration project

The overall goal of the project is to ensure sustainable and cost-effective phase-out of HCFC through implementation of a combination of interlinked measures of non-investment and technical assistance components. These measures, supported by the national legislation, monitoring and targeted information promotion activities will enable Georgia to phase out HCFCs according to the schedule of the Montreal Protocol.

Verification of the objectives and goals reached within terminal phase-out management plan for Chlorofluorocarbons in Georgia. Provide a detailed analysis of the data that proves and confirms that the results for reduction of Ozone Depleting Substances consumption were reached. The verification exercise will look into the Ozone Depleting Substances import-export framework with regards to the country's commitment.

Enhancement of Government capacities for implementation of the  Hydrochlorofluorocarbon phase-out schedules enhanced through developing investment activities in the refrigeration sector under the Hydrochlorofluorocarbon phase-out management plan.

The overall goal of the project is to ensure sustainable and cost-effective phase-out of HCFC through implementation of a combination of interlinked measures of non-investment and technical assistance components. These measures, supported by the national legislation, monitoring and targeted information promotion activities will enable Georgia to phase out HCFCs according to the schedule of the Montreal Protocol.

project_descr: Enabling Activities for Implementation of Montreal Protocol in Georgia
project_title: Enabling Activities for Impl. of Montreal Protocol
